preferences.title: Preferences
preferences.preferenceTips: These settings are saved in your browser for easy reuse. Some options require refreshing the page to take effect.
preferences.ipSourcesToCheckTips: Select the number of servers to check your IP address. The more servers you select, the more time it will take to complete the check.
preferences.autoRunTips: If disabled, the app will only check the local IP and will not run tests automatically.
preferences.showMapTips: Displays a map on the IP info card.
preferences.simpleModeTips: Reduces the information displayed on IP cards. Effective on mobile devices only.
preferences.connectivityAutoRefreshTips: When enabled, the app runs five checks at startup and displays the lowest latency.
preferences.popupConnectivityNotificationsTips: When enabled, the initial check's results are shown as a pop-up alert.
preferences.ipDBTips: You can select the default IP geolocation source to use. If the selected source is unavailable, the system will use the subsequent sources in order.

censorshipcheck.Title: Censorship Check
censorshipcheck.Note: Checks the availability of target websites in four regions known for rigorous internet censorship, including: Mainland China, Saudi Arabia, Russia, and Turkey. Tests are also conducted from regions with relatively free internet as a control group for verification. Some regions have clear legal provisions for internet censorship, while others are more vague.
censorshipcheck.Note2: Please enter a URL or domain name to start the censorship test:
censorshipcheck.Note3: A website is only considered blocked if it cannot be accessed from all servers within the same country.
censorshipcheck.isBlocked: This website appears to be blocked in some countries, please refer to the test results above for a final determination.
censorshipcheck.notBlocked: This website does not appear to be blocked, please refer to the test results above for a final determination.
censorshipcheck.isDown: It's unclear whether this website is blocked, as it appears to be inaccessible from many locations worldwide. If the address you entered is correct, it's possible that the website itself is having issues and cannot be accessed.

invisibilitytest.Title: Invisibility Test
invisibilitytest.Note: When you use a proxy or VPN, do the websites you visit really not know that you are using a proxy? Are you truly invisible? We will use various methods to try to calculate the vulnerabilities in your disguise and find evidence that you are using a proxy. Although some test results may not be completely accurate, this test is still highly informative.
invisibilitytest.Note2: After clicking Run, the system will run a script that usually completes all tests within 10 seconds. During this process, your IP information, browser information, etc. will be collected and analyzed in the background.
invisibilitytest.isProxy: You may be using a proxy.
invisibilitytest.notProxy: No evidence of you using a proxy was found.
invisibilitytest.isVPN: You may be using a VPN.
invisibilitytest.notVPN: No evidence of you using a VPN was found.

blocklist.title: VPN/Proxy Blocklist
blocklist.proxy: Your IP is in the VPN/Proxy blocklist.
blocklist.notProxy: Your IP is not in the VPN/Proxy blocklist.

headers.title: HTTP Headers
headers.proxy: Your HTTP headers contain proxy information, indicating that you may be using a proxy.
headers.notProxy: Your HTTP headers do not contain proxy information.

datacenter.title: Datacenter IP
datacenter.proxy: Your IP is a datacenter IP, which is not typically used by regular users. Detected datacenter:
datacenter.notProxy: Your IP is not a datacenter IP.

tcp.title: TCP Fingerprint
tcp.proxy: The system you are connecting to is different from your computer system, indicating that you may be using a proxy. Although the system's judgment may not be accurate, it is certain that the two systems are different.
tcp.server: The system you are connecting to may be:
tcp.notProxy: The system you are connecting to is the same as your computer system.

timezone.title: Timezone Difference
timezone.proxy: Your timezone does not match the geolocation timezone of your IP, indicating that you may be using a proxy.
timezone.server: The geolocation timezone of your IP is:
timezone.notProxy: Your timezone matches the geolocation timezone of your IP.

net.title: Network Resolution
net.proxy: Network resolution indicates that you may be using a proxy or VPN.
net.notProxy: No evidence of you using a proxy or VPN was found in network resolution.

webrtc.title: WebRTC Detection
webrtc.proxy: WebRTC detected multiple IP addresses from different regions, indicating that you may be using a proxy or VPN.
webrtc.notProxy: No evidence of multiple IP addresses from different regions was found in WebRTC detection.

flow.title: Traffic Analysis
flow.proxy: Traffic analysis indicates that you may be using a proxy or VPN.
flow.notProxy: No evidence of you using a proxy or VPN was found in traffic analysis.

latency.title: Latency Analysis
latency.proxy: Latency analysis indicates that you may be using a proxy or VPN.
latency.notProxy: No evidence of you using a proxy or VPN was found in latency analysis.

highlatency.title: High Latency Analysis
highlatency.proxy: High latency analysis indicates that you may be using a proxy or VPN.
highlatency.notProxy: No evidence of you using a proxy or VPN was found in high latency analysis.

advancedtools.Title: Advanced Tools
advancedtools.Note: Tools that are used relatively infrequently, but are very useful when performing network testing.
advancedtools.RuleTestNote: Check the rule settings of proxy software
advancedtools.CensorshipCheck: Check if a website is blocked in some countries
advancedtools.InvisibilityTest: Check if you are using a proxy or VPN
advancedtools.MacChecker: Query information of a physical address

macchecker.Title: MAC Lookup
macchecker.Note: Query the manufacturer of a physical address (MAC address), whether it is unicast/multicast, global/local, etc. Supports querying with a complete 12-digit address or just the prefix. You can also use this tool to verify if the physical address you generated meets your needs.
macchecker.Note2: Please enter a physical address to start the query:

whois.Title: Whois Search
whois.Note: Whois search is a service used to retrieve domain registration information. By entering a domain name or IP address, you can retrieve information such as the domain's registration details, registrar, registration date, expiration date, and more. The Whois information for IP addresses and domain names may have different fields. Additionally, some less common top-level domains (TLDs) may not have available information for Whois queries.
whois.Note2: Please enter a domain name or IP address to start the query:
whois.Note3: Whois information contains various types of fields. The following is the raw text information
whois.fetchError: Unable to fetch query results or query results are empty

dnsresolver.Title: DNS Resolution
dnsresolver.Note: In some regions, due to political or commercial reasons, some operators may contaminate certain domain names, resulting in incorrect results when accessed directly. Using DNS resolution checks will help you inspect the resolution results of domain names from well-known DNS providers around the world. Among the built-in DNS tests, some providers are from China, whose DNS resolution results may be contaminated. Please be discerning.
dnsresolver.Note2: Please enter a URL or domain name to start resolution:

ruletest.Title: Rule Test
ruletest.Name: Test
ruletest.Note: Rule test is used to determine if the proxy software's domain-based rules are set correctly. Before conducting the test, you need to refer to the card below and set different domain-based routing rules for the 8 different URLs of IPTool.uk in your proxy software.

ipInfos.Title: IP Infos
ipInfos.Notes: The program will first check your IP address from different sources (including IPv4 and IPv6), and then query the corresponding geographical data from the IP geolocation source you selected. If there is only 1 IP stack, the source without data will be displayed as empty.
ipInfos.IPv4Error: Fetch Failed or No IPv4 Address
ipInfos.IPv6Error: Fetch Failed or No IPv6 Address

proxyDetect.yes: Must be a proxy or VPN

connectivity.Title: Network Connectivity
connectivity.Note: Testing is done by loading small images from corresponding websites. Delay values are for reference only and will be smaller in reality.

webrtc.Title: WebRTC Test
webrtc.Note: WebRTC often establishes connections directly via UDP. If the test returns your real IP, it means your proxy settings do not cover these connections. In addition to detecting the IP you use when connecting to WebRTC, we also detect your NAT type. However, NAT type detection is not 100% accurate and is for reference only.

NATType.srflx: Possibly Port Restricted Cone or Symmetric NAT

dnsleaktest.Name: Test
dnsleaktest.Title: DNS Leak Test
dnsleaktest.Note: A DNS leak means that when you are connected to a VPN/proxy, your domain name resolutions are still done through your local ISP, thus posing a risk of DNS leaks.
dnsleaktest.Note2: The method to test for DNS leaks involves accessing a newly generated domain name to detect which regional DNS exit you are resolving through. If the endpoint region returned matches your local service provider's region, there is a risk of DNS leakage. In this case, you may need to modify your VPN/proxy settings.

speedtest.Title: Speed Test
speedtest.Note: Speed test will be done via Cloudflare's edge network, which may take a long time. If your network is located in mainland China, the data may be biased. The speed test results are for reference only, the actual speed will be faster. You can choose the packet size for download and upload tests. By default, the speed test will perform 4 rounds of packet uploads and downloads, please be mindful of data usage.
speedtest.score: Based on the speed test, got the following quality scores:
speedtest.resultNote: . The score is for reference only.

pingtest.Title: Global Latency Test
pingtest.Note: Ping test is a network tool used to measure the round-trip time of data packets from your device to specific targets (in this case, our servers located in different continents and regions). It is a key metric for evaluating network performance.
pingtest.Note2: In this process, IPTool.uk sends small packets of data from servers around the world to your IP address and measures the time it takes for these packets to travel from the server to your device and back. Through these Ping tests from different geographical locations, you can gain a comprehensive view of the speed and stability of your device's connection to the global network.
pingtest.Note3: Please select your IP address for testing.
pingtest.Error: Test failed, it looks like your IP is not allowed to perform Ping test.

mtrtest.Title: MTR Test
mtrtest.Note: The MTR (My Traceroute) test performs detailed route tracing of your IP address from servers located in different continents and regions around the world. MTR combines the functionality of traditional traceroute and ping commands to diagnose the quality and performance of network connections in real-time.
mtrtest.Note2: This process covers the complete path from various geographical locations to your network environment, providing information on latency and packet loss for each hop. Whether it's congestion in the routing path, latency issues at a specific node, or packet loss during transmission, the MTR test provides critical diagnostic information.
mtrtest.Note3: Please select your IP address for testing.
mtrtest.Error: Test failed, it looks like your IP is not allowed to perform MTR test.

ipcheck.Title: IP Check
ipcheck.Error: Please enter a valid IPv4 or IPv6 address.

alert.OhNo_Message: Connectivity test failed, some websites are not accessible.
alert.Congrats_Message: All connectivity tests passed, you can access all websites.
alert.maskedInfoMessage_1: IP information has been masked, please be careful when taking screenshots.
alert.maskedInfoMessage: All information has been masked, you can now safely take screenshots.
alert.unmaskedInfoMessage: Information has been unmasked, please be careful when taking screenshots.

shortcutKeys.HelpNote: People who use shortcuts are really awesome!

page.title: IPTool.uk - Check My IP Address and Geolocation - Check WebRTC Connection IP - DNS Leak Test - Speed Test - Jason Ng Open Source
page.description: A better and open source IP Toolbox. Easy to check what's your IPs, IP information, check for DNS leaks, examine WebRTC connections, test website availability, lookup DNS record, lookup Whois, and test latency from around the world.
page.keywords: MyIP,IP Tool,My IP,IP check,IP lookup,DNS leak test,WebRTC test,Speed test,DNS lookup,Whois lookup, Ping test, privacy test
page.footerName: made with love and open source

about.Title: About
about.product1: IPTool.uk is a free IP toolbox that helps you check your IP information, test website availability, examine DNS exit information, perform speed tests, global latency tests, MTR tests, and more.
about.product2: This is an open-source project, and you can view the source code by clicking on the GitHub icon at the bottom of the page.
about.product3: Initially, this was a personal project for me to learn Vue.js and how to write code using ChatGPT. Over time, it gained more stars on GitHub, so I did a lot of refactoring and added many useful features. I hope you will enjoy it.
about.me1: My name is Jason Ng, also known as Achán online. I'm not a professional programmer, but I love coding, open-source, and sharing.
about.me2: Most of the time, I work as a product manager, a blogger, a motorcyle rider and a geek.
about.me3: You can find a more detailed introduction about me in the following link:
about.contact: If you have any questions or suggestions, please contact me via email: info[AT]iptool.uk.

content.change: Display IP information before and after proxy
Refactored the entire project using Vue2
Support displaying Bing maps in the frontend
Support PWA, can be installed on mobile and desktop
Support retrieving IP geolocation information from multiple sources
Refactored the entire project using Vite + Vue3
Multiple performance and user experience optimizations
Added support for a new language: French
Added support for using different IP geolocation sources
Improved user experience for connection availability detection
Optimized UI for displaying IP information
Optimized home page structure, advanced features are now collapsible
Network speed test now allows custom packet size
Added preferences panel to save settings locally
Allow customization of multiple default behaviors on second program launch
Optimized display and animation effects for advanced tools
Refactored the entire project using Vue 3's Composition API
Split the frontend into multiple modules to improve maintainability
